intro: Sabulina brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh environmental conditions.
